intro: Ichnanthus pallidus, commonly known as the pale ichnanthus, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Onagraceae family, which includes other flowering plants such as willows and evening primroses. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Ichnanthus pallidus is often found in moist, sandy soils along streambanks and in open woodlands.
